page.title: 14Bickleigh/Wotter recreation
page.content: The village green at Bickleigh is a long triangle of well kept grass with a few large trees.The only playing fields are those within the camp and not on public access. Wotter has a recreation hall under the Methodist Church.The children's playground is a piece of moorland with rough grazing continuing around the swings,slide and seat.It is invaded by bracken and gorse and has a hut circle amongst the boulders.Residents complain of inadequate parking facilities and compare it unfavourably with the old playground which was cut off from the village when the by-pass road was built.One farm which borders on the open moor has been converted into a high class livery stable and Camping Club site.The National Park Authority will not permit development of a caravan camp.
